definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: When you have gone a 540, you will see your landing.
sentences.chinese: 当你已经转了540度，你将开始看你的着陆点。

sentences.english: Beacon must be placed in the designated LZ.
sentences.chinese: 信标必须安置在指定的着陆点。

sentences.english: Turn right heading350 to intercept the localizer, 27 miles from the touchdown.
sentences.chinese: 右转航向350切入航道，距着陆点27海里。

sentences.english: A low orbit will allow for better scouting of future landing sites, said Lele.
sentences.chinese: 拉勒认为较低的轨道有利于更好地考察未来的着陆点。

sentences.english: The re-entry capsule landed safely 21 hours after the launch at the landing site in Inner Mongolia .
sentences.chinese: 返回舱在启动后21小时安全降落在内蒙古的着陆点。
